subject: Minimum Value of IPC under Various Civil Works Contracts
text: #4 <r4t4 TToAf yfaahRuT Ph 91-11-508035 91-11-508098 (73+ 4ar7 3 TTTAT HATr4 91-11-508035 National Highways Authority of India Fax 91-11.50804â‚¬ 91-11-508042 (Ministry of Road Transport & Highways) 91-11-508036 G-5 8 6, SECTOR-10 DWARKA NEW DELHI 10045 No. 11014/21/2002/Admn II June 5 2002 POLICY MATTERS:_ADMNNSTRATIONFNNANCE[06/2002] [Decision taken on Finance Division File No. NHAIIF&A/2002/178] MNM VALLEE QF PPC LNDERVARIQUS CIVIL WORKS CONTRACTS References   have been   received for  relaxation in the minimum value  of the monthly Interim Payment Certificate [IPC] prescribed in the civil works contracts with a view to provide the contractors with adequate liquid funds to maintain the progress of the projects This issue was also raised during the recent meetings held at the level of Hon'ble Minister of State[IC], Road Transport & Highways. The matter has been examined in detail   keeping in view the problems projected by the contractors and it has been decided to relax the condition of minimum value of IPC prescribed in various civil works contracts, oly during the initial stages of the project i.e._ till the time the progress payments made to the contractors reach a level of 20%/ of the initial contract value Once the progress payments reach a level of 20%/ of the initial contract value, the prescribed IPC threshold as per the   provisions of the civil works contract shall be strictly adhered to for release of payments This issues with the approval of the Competent Authority.
